info.title: friends-api
info.description:
RallyHere Friends API. These set of APIS will are used to manage a Players list of Friends and Blocked Players.

Note: When the other Player declines the Player's Friend request, the FriendShip status is set to FRIENDSHIP_DECLINED_BY_OTHER_PLAYER and counts towards the Player's Friend limit. Clients are expected to delete the relationship and optionally inform the Player about the declined request.

get.summary: Get Friends List For Player V2
get.description:
Fetch the friend's list for the Player and their relationship status with those friends.

Note: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response. Clients can utilize the if-none-match header to avoid having to reload the response if it has not changed.

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

schema.title: If-None-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

parameters.name: if-none-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

304.description: Content still has the same etag and has not changed

delete.description: Remove the friend's relationship status with the other players

get.description:
Get the relationship status with the other Player.

Note: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response. Clients and then utilize the if-none-match header to avoid having to reload the response if it has not changed or to use it to modify the relationship without loosing updates.

Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:read

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

schema.title: If-None-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

parameters.name: if-none-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

304.description: Content still has the same etag and has not changed

put.description:
Modify the friend's relationship status with the other Player. There is a max number of friends that can be added for a Player. The limit can determined using [this API](/#/Configuration%20V1/get_friends_and_block_limits). This API allows you optionally update the player's notes for the other player. If you do not want to update or set the notes when adding the other player, then do not include a body.

Note: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response and will match the etag value provided when [fetching Friend Relationship between these two players](/#/Friends%20V1/get_friend_relationship). It is highly recommended to provide the etag value with the if-match header to avoid lost updates.

Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:write

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

schema.title: If-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

parameters.name: if-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

412.description: The resource's Etag does not match the Etag provided. Get the Etag from the Get request and try again

delete.description:
Remove the friend's relationship status with the other Player. This should be used for declining Friend requests, deleting sent Friends Requests, and deleting Friends

Note: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response and will match the etag value provided when [fetching Friend Relationship between these two players](#/Friends V1/get_friend_relationship). It is highly recommended to provide the etag value with the if-match header to avoid lost updates.

Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:write

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

schema.title: If-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

parameters.name: if-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

412.description: The resource's Etag does not match the Etag provided. Get the Etag from the Get request and try again

put.description:
Update Player's notes on the other player. Players can only add notes for players they have relationship's with. The notes will be removed when the relationship is ended.

Permissions Required: friend:friend_list:write

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

schema.title: If-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that does not matches the current ETag for this resource, a 412 response will be return - indicating that the resource has changed.

get.summary: Get Blocked List For Player V2
get.description:
Fetch the blocked list for the Player.

Note: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response. Clients can utilize the if-none-match header to avoid having to reload the response if it has not changed.

Permissions Required: friend:block_list:read

parameters.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

schema.title: If-None-Match
schema.description: If you provide the ETag that matches the current ETag for this resource, a 304 response will be return - indicating that the resource has not changed.

parameters.name: if-none-match

ETag.description: Used to identify this version of the content.  Provide with a get request to avoid downloading the same data multiple times.

304.description: Content still has the same etag and has not changed

get.description:
Get the Blocked Player

Permissions Required: friend:block_list:read

put.description:
Block the other Player. There is a max number of Players that can be blocked per Player. The limit can determined using [this API](/#/Configuration%20V1/get_friends_and_block_limits).

Permissions Required: friend:block_list:write

delete.description:
Unblock the other Player

Permissions Required: friend:block_list:write

get.description:
Fetch the blocked list for the Player.

Note: This API supports etags and will return the etag header when with the response. Clients can utilize the if-none-match header to avoid having to reload the response if it has not changed.

Unblock the other Player

Permissions Required: friend:block_list:write

get.description: Fetch the configuration used by Friends API, e.g. friend_limit, block_limit, etc.

BlockedList.title: BlockedList
BlockedList.description: The list of players that is blocked.

BlockedListV1.title: BlockedListV1
BlockedListV1.description: The list of players that is blocked. V1 includes player_id and player_uuid.

last_modified_on.title: The time when the friends relationship was last modified

BlockedPlayer.title: BlockedPlayer
BlockedPlayer.description: The player that is being blocked.

last_modified_on.title: The time when the friends relationship was last modified

BlockedPlayerV1.title: BlockedPlayerV1
BlockedPlayerV1.description: The player that is being blocked. V1 includes player_id and player_uuid.

notes.title: Player's notes about the other player

last_modified_on.title: The time when the friends relationship was last modified

FriendRelationship.title: FriendRelationship
FriendRelationship.description: Represents the relationship with a potential friend.

notes.title: Player's notes about the other player

last_modified_on.title: The time when the friends relationship was last modified

FriendRelationshipV1.title: FriendRelationshipV1
FriendRelationshipV1.description: Represents the relationship with a potential friend. V1 includes player_id and player_uuid.

friends.title: List of Player UUIDs to operate on

Friends.title: Friends
Friends.description: List of player_uuids to operate on.

friend_limit.title: Friend Limit
friend_limit.description: Maximum number of friends a user can have

block_limit.title: Block Limit
block_limit.description: Maximum number of blocked users a user can have

FriendsList.title: FriendsList
FriendsList.description: List of the player's friends. Includes sent friend requests and received friends requests.

FriendsListV1.title: FriendsListV1
FriendsListV1.description: List of the player's friends. Includes sent friend requests and received friends requests.

friends.title: List of Player IDs to operate on

FriendsV1.title: FriendsV1
FriendsV1.description: List of player_ids to operate on.

notes.title: Notes to set for the Player's friend. If you don't want to modify notes, no not include a body when adding a friend.

Notes.title: Notes
Notes.description: Notes to set for the Player's friend. If you don't want to modify notes, no not include in body when adding a friend.

tags.name: Friends V1
tags.description: Operations to fetch and modify a player's friends. Note: V1 and V2 are not be be used together. Once you begin using V2, you must not use V1 anymore.

tags.name: Friends V2
tags.description: Operations to fetch and modify a player's friends using player uuids

tags.name: Blocked V1
tags.description: Operations to fetch and modify a player's blocked list. Note: V1 and V2 are not be be used together. Once you begin using V2, you must not use V1 anymore.

tags.name: Blocked V2
tags.description: Operations to fetch and modify a player's blocked list using player uuids

tags.name: Configuration V1
tags.description: Operations to view configuration for friends and blocked lists
